anecdotes.text: He was a wise man who invented beer.
Beer, if drunk in moderation, softens the temper, cheers the spirit and promotes health.
In a study, scientists report that drinking beer can be good for the liver. I’m sorry, did I say ‘scientists’? I meant Irish people.
Most people hate the taste of beer—to begin with. It is, however, a prejudice.
Beer, it’s the best damn drink in the world.
I’ve only been in love with a beer bottle and a mirror.
There is no such thing as a bad beer. It’s that some taste better than others.
God has a brown voice, as soft and full as beer.
Beer’s intellectual. What a shame so many idiots drink it.
Stay with the beer. Beer is continuous blood. A continuous lover.
A man who lies about beer makes enemies
Whoever drinks beer, he is quick to sleep; whoever sleeps long, does not sin; whoever does not sin, enters Heaven! Thus, let us drink beer!
anecdotes.by: Martin Luther, German professor of theology, monk

anecdotes.text: For a quart of Ale is a dish for a king.
Oh, this beer here is cold, cold and hop-bitter, no point coming up for air, gulp, till it’s all–hahhhh.
Give me a woman who loves beer and I will conquer the world.
anecdotes.by: Kaiser Wilhelm, Last King of Prussia
